title: Sectional Mock 5 - English
instruction: Fill in the blanks with appropriate words to make the passage meaningful.With the announcement that he would donate Rs. 8,846 crore of his equity in the company to the philanthropic trust he controls, the founder and chairman of infotech giant Wipro Ltd., Azim Premji has set the    (1)     very high for other mega rich businessmen of the country. The 28th richest man in the world, and India’s third richest could not have made a better and more sound    (2)     choice than this. His Azim Premji Foundation is already working in the rural areas of the country to improve the quality of education and is not in the process of setting up a university for the poor. This    (3)     will be a welcome addition to the kitty of a sector that has the capability to transform India but is badly handicapped due to the lack of adequate funding. Other IT majors Infosys, MindTree, TCS and HCL also support programmes that support social equity.At a time when India’s economic footprint on the global stage is rising, the    (4)     between the different strata of society has also been increasing. This is not a positive development and the underprivileged sections need to be equipped with life skills so that they too can be a part of the growth story. A very basic requirement of this life skills development is to educate them and make them employable. The fact that most of the heads of these IT majors are    (5)     first-generation entrepreneurs    (6)     that education, more than anything else, is a great leveler. At the same time, the improved economic conditions will also push up people into the middle-class bracket and make India a much more attractive market.

quiz.text: Which among the following is correct regarding the impact of flood in India over the years starting from 1970s?
options: The loss of lives has decreased in these years but the economic losses have increased manifold in this duration.
The losses have quantified because of the fact that the population of the country is also on the rise.
There is no information available in the government how the figures have redeveloped in all these years.
This should be understood without concern that it has to be quantified with so many things under consideration.
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is correct regarding the pattern of rainfall in the future as declared by the scientific community?
options: The rains will be very much severe in nature and all the areas will go under the water in no time.
The rains will see a very dry spell though in some areas the case will not be the same any more.
The rains in India will not suffer any change in the pattern though others will not understand the fact.
The rainfall in the future is going to be very much irregular and it is not going to follow a predicted pattern.
None of these

quiz.text: Select the correct pair.A. I. The music industry is constantly evolving and is cyclical so you always need to have your ‘fingers on the pulse’ or risk being termed obsolete.II. In a B-school interview, along with intelligence, an aspirant is also expected to be full of confidence and passion. B. I. His enthusiasm is not only unbelievable but contagious and he simply does not ‘let the grass grow under his feet.’II. The much-delayed auction of Taj Man Singh is likely to be postponed yet again as the New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) got less than the required number of bids for the iconic property to go under the hammer. C. I. The coach asked the player to either ‘shape up or ship out.’II. After multiple incidents similar to this one, she was finally given an ultimatum to improve her efficiency or risk being axed.
options: Only I
Only III
Only I and II
Only II and III
All of the above

quiz.text: Choose the correct sentence connector from the options given below.
options: Only A-F
Only B-D
Only B-D and C-E
Only A-F, C-E
None of these

quiz.text: Alphabet Inc's YouTube is creating scripted series and other original programming for international markets including France, Germany, Japan, Mexico and India to try to draw new customers to its paid subscription service. _________________. It will be produced in local languages and subtitled or dubbed for other markets. Some of the programming will appear on YouTube Premium, the monthly subscription service formerly called YouTube Red. Other content will be available on YouTube's free service with advertising. YouTube will be competing with companies including Netflix Inc and Amazon.com Inc that are investing in local language programming for online audiences around the world. _________________.
options: YouTube already has released a handful of original shows in South Korea and one in India, a talk show in Hindi about cricket. / There are no current plans for more original children's programming as the company does not believe children's content will drive subscriptions to YouTube Premium at this time.

The programmes will come in the form of multiple genres such as music documentaries, reality series, talk shows and scripted series/ In its bid to gain an edge over other streaming platforms YouTube has decided to collaborate with local streaming services.

It's no secret that streaming giants Netflix and Amazon are spending large sums of money to strengthen their footholds in the digital video landscape. / The first original shows from YouTube debuted on its premium service in 2016, starting with series from some of the platform's most popular video creators.
Both A and C
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is true as per the passage? I. The GST has opened up a can of worms and needs to be scrapped.II. There would be no frauds after the Aadhar is linked with taxpayers.III. The new dealers have to physically go for new registrations.
options: Only II
Only III
Only I and II
Only II and III
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is closest in meaning to the word ‘ONEROUS’?
options: Arduous
Exempt
Effortless
Futile
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following can be inferred from below statement?‘Given the complexity of the legacy taxes that GST subsumed and replaced and the teething troubles of operating a new tax system, ensuring optimal outcomes has proved an abiding challenge’?
options: There will be life-long problems in operating GST as it is a new tax system.
GST council is doing its best to provide handsome gains while fighting unscrupulous operators.
It’s a long road ahead for GST to provide best possible results due to some hurdles and the vast number of laws it subsumed.
GST is bound to fail as it has loopholes to exploit so it is under review.
None of the above

quiz.text: Choose the correct sentence connector from the options given below.
options: Only A-E
Only C-D
Only A-E and B-F
Only A-E, C-D
None of these

quiz.text: Choose the correct sentence connector from the options given below.
options: Only A-F
Only B-D
Only B-D and C-E
Only A-F, B-D
None of these

quiz.text: Find the error. I. The supreme court of India disapprovedII. the practice of constituting commissions of inquiryIII. at the cost of taxpayers and let them continue for years togetherIV. without serving any useful purpose.
options: Only I and III
Only II and IV
Only IV
Only III
No error

quiz.text: Find the errorI. Between 2010 and 2017, several countriesII. make rapid progressIII. in reducing HIV incidence andIV. getting antiretroviral therapy of patients.
options: Only I and IV
Only I and III
I, III and IV
Only I
No error

quiz.text: Any improvement in compliance under GST, in the form of the number of registered taxpayers and even the returns filed, without an increase in the revenue reported, reiterates the fact that GST is still a work in progress.
options: GST would continue to be considered a work in progress till the time there is not an increase in the revenue reported even though there may be an improvement in compliance under GST in terms of the number of registered taxpayers and the also returns filed.

When there is any improvement in the form of the number of registered taxpayers and even the returns filed in compliance under GST, with no increase in the revenue reported, makes that GST is still a work in progress.

With number of registered taxpayers increasing even as the returns filed slow down indicating to improvement in compliance under GST, signifies there is no increase in the revenue reported and that GST will need more push.

Despite an improvement on compliance over GST, there is no increase in the revenue reported while there is an increase in the form of the number of registered taxpayers and even the returns filed, which makes GST a work in progress.
None of the above

quiz.text: If the government really wants to take care of the environment, it should ban all kinds of industries in the country but that is practically impossible.
options: The government is not keen on preserving the environment and that is why India is growing as an industrial country.
Indians are so industrious that they always run after setting up new industries and that contributes towards the pollution of the environment.
Blanket ban on the industries, however unfeasible, is the only way out for the government to save the environment.
The government is serious about preserving the environment but in some other ways.
Industries pollute the environment but at the same time they provide livelihood to a lot of people in the country.

quiz.text: In this generally upbeat environment, hardly any analyst wants to ____________ and state in a research report that the excitement about the rupee depreciation is overdone as far as IT stocks are concerned. I. Put their necks on the lineII. Go out on a limbIII. Stick their necks out
options: Only II
Only III
Only I and II
Only I and III
All of the above

quiz.text: A.  The egregious practice that many Muslim men employ to divorce their wives instantaneously and without their consent, merely by uttering the word talaq thrice, was rendered legally invalid by the Shamim Ara vs State of UP judgment of 2002 and subsequent orders from various High Courts. B. This practice has been either explicitly derecognised in Muslim-majority countries such as Indonesia, Iran and Tunisia or implicitly in countries such as Pakistan, which provides for a mandatory arbitration procedure after the pronouncement of talaq.C. Shayara Bano, one such victim of this arbitrary custom — not to speak of years of domestic violence — has filed a public interest litigation in the Supreme Court seeking a ban on the practice.D. But this has not stopped the practice; many Muslim women are unaware of the judgments or have had to accept such pronouncements owing to pressure from conservative sections. E. The conservative All India Muslim Personal Law Board that seeks to wield influence on questions of Muslim personal law has, predictably, found it an occasion to air its regressive views on the issue.
options: A
B
C
D
E

quiz.text: A. But a premature lowering of the guard and growing resistance to DDT led to rising incidence in the 1980s.B. Some of the major challenges the country had to face before it interrupted local transmission were the Plasmodium falciparum parasite becoming resistant to the chloroquine drug, behavioural changes in the vector, asymptomatic carriers and vector reintroduction.C. Sri Lanka was close to eliminating malaria in 1963, when it reported just 17 cases.D. But the tide turned from 2000 when a steady reduction in the number of cases was recorded.E. The public sector and the private sector were oriented to the common goal of eliminating malaria by enhancing case notification and achieving 100 per cent detection and confirmation through tests.
options: A
B
C
D
E

quiz.text: A. India should use the interdependency and pressure-compromise strategies to leverage its interest to isolate Pakistan. B. India has to fix its domestic issues to further social cohesion and make special efforts to build bridges between communities. C. India needs to move on in the international system. D. In some ways it has, but in other ways it is moving backwards. Its foreign policy is only an extension of its domestic politics. E. This will give it an edge in the international system.
options: A
B
C
D
E

quiz.text: A. The science of central banking is still evolving. B. The concept of an independent central bank evolved in advanced economies and finds its roots in the successful anti-inflationary policy of Paul Volcker in the U.S. between 1979 and ‘82.C. The need is to recognise that there is a clear distinction in the functioning of central banks in advanced and emerging market economies.D. In 1900, there were hardly a dozen central banks and each had been initially created to dispense some specific function of the government, mainly to issue currency and coinage or manage foreign exchange reserves. E. The evolution, as always, has not been easy and has had its share of challenges.
options: A
B
C
D
E

quiz.text: Choose the word that is most OPPOSITE in meaning.Vital
options: Dull
Sluggish
Unimportant
Additional
Extra

quiz.text: Choose the word that is most SIMILAR in meaning.Harness
options: To fasten
To plough
To control
To utilize
To withdraw

quiz.text: Which one or more of the following factors is/are recommended by the UN-Habitat report as essential for planned urbanisation and growth?1. The master plan proposed by the first, National Commission on urbanisation.2. The strategic spatial planning system.3. A strong institutional framework for planning encouraging people’s participation.Select the correct answer using the codes given below
options: Only 1
2 and 3
1, 2 and 3
1 and 3
None of these

quiz.text: What, according to the author, are the main components of a ‘formal city’?
options: The historical core, the colonial enclave and the newly developed areas.
Pre-independence and post-independence areas.
New city and old city
Planned city and the unplanned city
None of these

quiz.text: It is implied in the passage that
options: Cities India have not been able to reap the real benefits of urbanisation due to lack of proper planning.
Urbanisation is not a desirable phenomenon
Urbanisation offers the solution for all the problems that smaller cities face
None of the above
All of the above

profit

consider
